p: TREM1 is an important regulator of innate immunity that promotes the amplification of inflammatory signals initiated by TLRs and NOD-like receptors [ 32]. TREM1 has been characterized as a major player in the pathophysiology of acute inflammatory diseases of different etiologies such as acute myocardial infarction, atherosclerosis, and infectious diseases [ 11, 33, 34]. TREM1 is an immune receptor expressed on innate immune cells, such as neutrophils, mature monocytes, macrophages [ 9], and platelets [ 35]. TREM1 is also expressed on lung alveolar macrophages, and this tissue-specific pattern of expression has suggested a potential role for this molecule in the activation of local inflammatory response during lung infections [ 36].
